t: Proverbs 12
Whoever*pn loves discipline loves knowledge, but*ld he who hates reproof is stupid.
A*ln good man obtains favor from the Lord,*s but*ld a man of evil devices he condemns.
No*ln one is established by wickedness, but*ld the root of the righteous will never be moved.
An*ln excellent wife is the crown of her husband, but*ld she who brings shame is like rottenness in his bones.
The*ln thoughts of the righteous are just; the*ld counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
The*ln words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but*ld the mouth of the upright delivers them.
The*ln wicked are overthrown and are no more, but*ld the house of the righteous will stand.
A*ln man is commended according to his good sense, but*ld one of twisted mind is despised.
Better*ln to be lowly and have a servant than*ld to play the great man and lack bread.
Whoever*ln is righteous has regard for the life of his beast, but*ld the mercy of the wicked is cruel.
Whoever*ln works his land will have plenty of bread, but*ld he who follows worthless pursuits lacks sense.
Whoever*ln is wicked covets the spoil of evildoers, but*ld the root of the righteous bears fruit.
An*ln evil man is ensnared by the transgression of his lips, but*ld the righteous escapes from trouble.
From*ln the fruit of his mouth a man is satisfied with good, and*ld the work of a man’s hand comes back to him.
The*ln way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but*ld a wise man listens to advice.
The*ln vexation of a fool is known at once, but*ld the prudent ignores an insult.
Whoever*ln speaks the truth gives honest evidence, but*ld a false witness utters deceit.
There*ln is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts, but*ld the tongue of the wise brings healing.
Truthful*ln lips endure forever, but*ld a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Deceit*ln is in the heart of those who devise evil, but*ld those who plan peace have joy.
No*ln ill befalls the righteous, but*ld the wicked are filled with trouble.
Lying*ln lips are an abomination to the Lord,*s but*ld those who act faithfully are his delight.
A*ln prudent man conceals knowledge, but*ld the heart of fools proclaims folly.
The*ln hand of the diligent will rule, while*ld the slothful will be put to forced labor.
Anxiety*ln in a man’s heart weighs him down, but*ld a good word makes him glad.
One*ln who is righteous is a guide to his neighbor, but*ld the way of the wicked leads them astray.
Whoever*ln is slothful will not roast his game, but*ld the diligent man will get precious wealth.
In*ln the path of righteousness is life, and*ld in its pathway there is no death.
